587  static RigidBodyDynamics::Math::MatrixNd

593 
594  /*
595  This function numerically integrates the Bezier curve y(x).
596 
597  @param vX Values of x to evaluate the integral of y(x)
598  @param ic0 The initial value of the integral
599  @param intAcc Accuracy of the integrated solution
600  @param uTol Tolerance on the calculation of the intermediate u term
601  @param uMaxIter Maximum number of iterations allowed for u to reach its
602  desired tolerance.
603  @param mX The 6xn matrix of Bezier control points for x(u)
604  @param mY The 6xn matrix of Bezier control points for y(u)
605 
606  @param flag_intLeftToRight Setting this flag to true will evaluate the
607  integral from the left most point to the right most
608  point. Setting this flag to false will cause the
609  integral to be evaluated from right to left.
610  @param name Name of caller.
611  @return RigidBodyDynamics::Math::MatrixNd Col 0: X vector, Col 1: int(y(x))
612 
613 
614  This function numerically integrates the Bezier curve y(x), when really
615  both x and y are specified in terms of u. Evaluate the integral at the
616  locations specified in vX and return the result.
617 
618  <B>Computational Costs</B>
619 
620  This the expense of this function depends on the number of points in
621  vX, the points for which the integral y(x) must be calculated. The
622  integral is evaluated using a Runge Kutta 45 integrator, and so each
623  point requires 6 function evaluations.
624  (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dormand%E2%80%93Prince_method)
625 
626  The cost of evaluating 1 Bezier curve y(x) scales with the number
627  of points in xVal:
628  \verbatim
629  ~1740 flops per point
630  \endverbatim
631 
632  The example below is quite involved, but just so it can show you an
633  example of how to create the array of Spline objects that approximate
634  the function u(x). Although the example has been created for only 1
635  Bezier curve set, simply changing the size and entries of the matricies
636  _mX and _mY will allow multiple sets to be integrated.
637 
638 
639  <B>Example:</B>
640  @code
641  //Integrator and u tolerance settings
642  double INTTOL = 1e-12;
643  double UTOL = 1e-14;
644  int MAXITER= 10;
645 
646  //Make up a Bezier curve - these happen to be the control points
647  //for a tendon curve
648  RigidBodyDynamics::Math::MatrixNd _mX(6,1), _mY(6,1);
649  _mX(0)= 1;
650  _mX(1)= 1.01164;
651  _mX(2)= 1.01164;
652  _mX(3)= 1.02364;
653  _mX(4)= 1.02364;
654  _mX(5)= 1.04;
655 
656  _mY(0) = 0;
657  _mY(1) = 3.10862e-16;
658  _mY(2) = 3.10862e-16;
659  _mY(3) = 0.3;
660  _mY(4) = 0.3;
661  _mY(5) = 1;
662 
663  _numBezierSections = 1;
664  bool _intx0x1 = true; //Says we're integrating from x0 to x1
666  //Generate the set of splines that approximate u(x)
668  RigidBodyDynamics::Math::VectorNd u(NUM_SAMPLE_PTS);
669  //Used for the approximate inverse
670  RigidBodyDynamics::Math::VectorNd x(NUM_SAMPLE_PTS);
671  //Used for the approximate inverse
672 
673  //Used to generate the set of knot points of the integral of y(x)
674  RigidBodyDynamics::Math::VectorNd
675  xALL(NUM_SAMPLE_PTS*_numBezierSections-(_numBezierSections-1));
676  _arraySplineUX.resize(_numBezierSections);
677  int xidx = 0;
678 
679  for(int s=0; s < _numBezierSections; s++){
680  //Sample the local set for u and x
681  for(int i=0;i<NUM_SAMPLE_PTS;i++){
682  u(i) = ( (double)i )/( (double)(NUM_SAMPLE_PTS-1) );
683  x(i) = SegmentedQuinticBezierToolkit::
684  calcQuinticBezierCurveVal(u(i),_mX(s),_name);
685  if(_numBezierSections > 1){
686  //Skip the last point of a set that has another set of points
687  //after it. Why? The last point and the starting point of the
688  //next set are identical in value.
689  if(i<(NUM_SAMPLE_PTS-1) || s == (_numBezierSections-1)){
690  xALL(xidx) = x(i);
691  xidx++;
692  }
693  }else{
694  xALL(xidx) = x(i);
695  xidx++;
696  }
697  }
698  //Create the array of approximate inverses for u(x)
699  _arraySplineUX[s] = SimTK::SplineFitter<double>::
700  fitForSmoothingParameter(3,x,u,0).getSpline();
701  }
702 
703 
705  //Compute the integral of y(x) and spline the result
707 
708  RigidBodyDynamics::Math::VectorNd yInt = SegmentedQuinticBezierToolkit::
709  calcNumIntBezierYfcnX(xALL,0,INTTOL, UTOL, MAXITER,_mX, _mY,
710  _arraySplineUX,_name);
711 
712  if(_intx0x1==false){
713  yInt = yInt*-1;
714  yInt = yInt - yInt(yInt.nelt()-1);
715  }
716 
717  _splineYintX = SimTK::SplineFitter<double>::
718  fitForSmoothingParameter(3,xALL,yInt,0).getSpline();
719 
720  @endcode
721 
722 
723  */
724
